title.narrative: 2. QUALITY CHILD PROTECTION SERVICE DELIVERY

description.narrative: By 2020 child protection institutions and stakeholders are better equipped to deliver a minimum package of services to children at risk of or affected by the prioritised deprivation., which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the most vulnerable girls and boys, especially those at risk of or affected by violence, exploitation and abuse, are better protected in their families and communities by institutions mandated for child protection and the society in general.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020 child protection institutions and stakeholders are better equipped to deliver a minimum package of services to children at risk of or affected by the prioritised deprivation.

description.narrative: UNICEF-Burkina Faso supported the decentralization of the Child protection (CP) system by setting up: 1) CP networks in 24 additional municipalities; and 2) seven regional continuums of care mechanisms (CCM) for children on the move. As a result, 92,971 children (51,841 girls) in 13 regions obtained access to holistic CP services based on individual needs, using the case management approach. In addition, UNICEF provided CP in emergency services to 69,460 emergency-affected children including 38,326 girls in the Sahel, Centre-Nord, Nord and Est regions, reaching less than half of the HAC target (95,000) due to a large funding gap. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of Women and children provided with prevention or response interventions to address gender-based violence
Number of Children reached with psychosocial support, including access to child friendly spaces/other safe spaces
Number of structures in charge of minors in contact with the law complying with the juvenile justice minimum standards

Number of girls and boys who have experienced violence reached by health, social work or justice/law enforcement services
Number of girls and boys affected by emergencies benefiting from psychosocial care services or prevention are responses to separation with families
Number of women and children in humanitarian situations who received Gender-Based Violence (GBV) response services through UNICEF-supported programmes

Number of girls and boys children at risk and affected by VAE receiving appropriate care (children affected by sexual abuse, corporal punishment, children with disabilities, children living on the street.)
Country with interoperable service delivery with Health : YES or NO ?
Country in which an inter-operable information management system supports and tracks case management, incident monitoring, and programme monitoring (all, including humanitarian) : YES or NO ?
